video.title: Time to Remember
video.synopsis: This intriguing documentary series uses footage from British Pathé newsreels to profile life through the decades, from Victorian times through 1945.

episodes.synopsis: Adventurous men and women, including the Wright Brothers and Charles Lindbergh, tame the wild blue yonder in the first half of the 20th century.
episodes.title: Pioneers of Aviation

episodes.synopsis: Charles Laughton, Mary Pickford and Douglas Fairbanks are featured in this captivating behind-the-scenes look at entertainment in the 1920s and 1930s.
episodes.title: Stage and Screen

episodes.synopsis: Poignant footage illustrates the tragic events of the two world wars, including trench warfare, the evacuation of Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain.
episodes.title: Casualties of War

episodes.synopsis: Footage of influential suffragette Emily Davison and tennis player Suzanne Lenglen illustrates how women's roles changed in the early 20th century.
episodes.title: A Woman's World

episodes.synopsis: Innovations and accomplishments that pushed the boundaries in the 20th century include early tank warfare and Scott's expedition to Antarctica.
episodes.title: Pushing the Boundaries

episodes.synopsis: Explore the lives of European royals through footage of Queen Victoria, Edward VII, Tsar Nicholas II, Victor Emmanuel, Franz Josef and George V.
episodes.title: The Royal Families

episodes.synopsis: The leisure activities of a more innocent era are revealed through footage of regattas, seaside escapades, fairgrounds and the Royal Ascot in 1919.
episodes.title: Nations at Play

episodes.synopsis: High hopes for lasting peace after World War I and the terrifying descent into another world war are illustrated by historic newsreel footage.
episodes.title: The Pursuit of Peace

episodes.synopsis: Crime is the lead story in these newsreels of such American gangsters as John Dillinger and Al Capone, and in footage of the Lindbergh baby trial.
episodes.title: Crime and Prohibition

episodes.synopsis: On the home front during the world wars, elephants perform farm labor, Londoners take cover in the Underground and children prepare for gas attacks.
episodes.title: Civilians at War

episodes.synopsis: Men and women around the globe break records of all kinds, including flyer Amelia Earhart, race car driver Malcolm Campbell and aviator Jean Batten.
episodes.title: The Need for Speed

episodes.synopsis: Difficult times from the early 20th century included the 1920 bombing of Wall Street, the 1926 U.K. General Strike and the 1930s American dustbowl.
episodes.title: In Times of Need
